scenarios.name: E2E - Successful User Onboarding, Formula Metric Creation, and Custom Target Configuration
scenarios.description: This end-to-end scenario verifies the complete happy path workflow: a user logs in, invites a new user who successfully accepts and creates an account, creates a new metric using the Formula Builder, adds it to 'My Dashboard KPIs', and configures a 'Custom' target for it.
user_journey: Step 1: Navigate to the Application and verify the login page is displayed.
Step 2: Enter the user's email address and click 'Continue'.
Step 3: Enter the user's password and click 'Login'.
Step 4: Select the correct company from the list.
Step 5: Click on 'Administration' to expand the dropdown menu.
Step 6: Click on 'Manage Users' and verify the page loads.
Step 7: Click the 'Invite Users' button and wait for the modal to appear.
Step 8: Enter the email address of the user to be invited.
Step 9: Set the 'Admin' checkbox state according to the test data.
Step 10: Click the 'Send Invite' button.
Step 11: Scroll to the 'Pending Invitations' section and verify it is visible.
Step 12: Find the invited user in the 'Pending Invitations' table.
Step 13: Click the tick/checkmark symbol to accept the invitation.
Step 14: On the 'Accept Invite' form, enter the user's first name.
Step 15: Enter the user's last name.
Step 16: Enter and create a password for the new user.
Step 17: Click the 'Accept Invite' button to create the account.
Step 18: Verify navigation to the dashboard after successful account creation.
Step 19: Navigate to the 'Metrics' page from the navigation menu.
Step 20: Click the 'Add Metric' button to open the creation form.
Step 21: Enter the metric name.
Step 22: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
Step 23: Verify the 'Formula Builder' interface is visible.
Step 24: Search for and select the first metric for the formula.
Step 25: Click on the desired operator button.
Step 26: Search for and select the second metric for the formula.
Step 27: Verify the complete formula is displayed correctly.
Step 14A: Select the specified 'Cadence' from the dropdown.
Step 14B: If Cadence is 'Weekly', select the 'Resets On' day.
Step 28: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
Step 29: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
STEP 18: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' via the 'Dashboards' menu.
STEP 19: Locate and click the 'Edit KPI' icon/button to open the modal.
STEP 21: Locate the newly created metric in the left panel of available metrics.
STEP 22: Click the metric in the left panel to move it to the right panel.
STEP 23: Click the 'Save' button in the modal to update the dashboard.
STEP 24: Wait for the dashboard to render and scroll to the 'My KPIs' section.
STEP 25: Identify and select the correct metric card for the newly added metric.
STEP 26: Hover over the metric card to reveal the three-dot menu button.
STEP 27: Click the three-dot menu button to open the dropdown menu.
STEP 28: Identify the active dropdown menu.
STEP 29: Click the 'Edit' option in the dropdown menu.
STEP 30: Wait for the Edit page to load completely.
STEP 31: Select the 'Target' tab if it is not already active.
Step 32A.1: Select the 'Custom' radio button.
Step 32A.2: Verify that 4 target input fields appear.
Step 32A.3: Enter the Level 1 target value.
Step 32A.4: Enter the Level 2 target value.
Step 32A.5: Enter the Level 3 target value.
Step 32A.6: Enter the Level 4 target value.
STEP 33: Click the 'Save' button to save the target configuration.
STEP 34: Verify the page navigates back to the dashboard after saving.
STEP 35: Locate the metric card and verify it displays the custom target indicators.
STEP 36: Perform a final verification of the metric card's name, value, and target visualization.
acceptance_criteria: User successfully logs in and selects a company.
A new user invitation is sent and successfully accepted, creating a new user account.
A new metric is successfully created using the Formula Builder.
The newly created metric is successfully added to the 'My KPIs' section of the dashboard.
A 'Custom' target with four levels is successfully configured and saved for the metric.
The metric card on the dashboard correctly displays visual indicators for the configured custom target.

scenarios.name: Successful Metric Creation using an Existing Metric as Value Source
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies that a user can successfully create a new metric where the 'Value Source' is an existing metric, not a formula. This tests the alternative path in the metric creation workflow.
user_journey: Step 19: Navigate to the 'Metrics' page from the navigation menu.
Step 20: Click the 'Add Metric' button to open the creation form.
Step 21: Enter the metric name.
Step 22: Select 'Metric' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
Step 10-ALT: Verify the metric selection interface is now visible.
Step 11-ALT: Search for and select the desired existing metric from the dropdown/list.
Step 14A: Select the specified 'Cadence' from the dropdown.
Step 14B: If Cadence is 'Weekly', select the 'Resets On' day.
Step 29: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
acceptance_criteria: The metric creation form loads correctly.
User can select 'Metric' as the value source, and the UI updates to show a metric search field.
User can successfully search for and select an existing metric.
The new metric is successfully saved with the selected existing metric as its source.

scenarios.name: Successful Configuration of a Time-Based Target for a Dashboard Metric
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies that a user can successfully locate a metric on their dashboard, navigate to its edit page, and configure and save a 'Time-Based' target.
user_journey: STEP 18: Navigate to 'My Dashboard'.
STEP 24: Wait for the dashboard to render and scroll to the 'My KPIs' section.
STEP 25: Identify and select the correct metric card for the target metric.
STEP 26: Hover over the metric card to reveal the three-dot menu button.
STEP 27: Click the three-dot menu button to open the dropdown menu.
STEP 29: Click the 'Edit' option in the dropdown menu.
STEP 30: Wait for the Edit page to load completely.
STEP 31: Select the 'Target' tab if it is not already active.
Step 32B.1: Select the 'Time-Based' radio button.
Step 32B.2: Verify that 'Start' and 'Target' input fields appear.
Step 32B.3: Enter the 'Start Value'.
Step 32B.4: Enter the 'Target Value'.
STEP 33: Click the 'Save' button to save the target configuration.
STEP 34: Verify the page navigates back to the dashboard after saving.
STEP 35: Locate the metric card and verify it displays the time-based progress indicator.
STEP 36: Perform a final verification of the metric card's name, value, and target visualization.
acceptance_criteria: User can successfully navigate from a dashboard metric card to its edit page.
The 'Time-Based' target option can be selected, revealing the 'Start' and 'Target' input fields.
The user can enter valid start and target values and save the configuration.
The page successfully redirects back to the dashboard.
The metric card on the dashboard is updated to display the configured time-based target, including a progress indicator and start/target values.

scenarios.name: Successful User Invitation and Account Onboarding
scenarios.description: This scenario focuses specifically on the user management happy path, where an admin user successfully invites a new user, and the new user is able to accept the invitation and create their account without any issues.
user_journey: Step 5: Navigate to the 'Administration' menu and expand it.
Step 6: Click on 'Manage Users' and wait for the page to load.
Step 7: Click the 'Invite Users' button.
Step 8: Enter the email address for the new user in the invite modal.
Step 9: Set admin privileges based on test data.
Step 10: Click the 'Send Invite' button.
Step 11: Verify the 'Pending Invitations' section is visible.
Step 12: Locate the newly invited user in the pending table.
Step 13: Click the accept invitation (tick/checkmark) icon for that user.
Step 14: On the 'Accept Invite' form, fill in the 'First Name'.
Step 15: Fill in the 'Last Name'.
Step 16: Fill in the 'Create Password' field.
Step 17: Click the 'Accept Invite' button to finalize account creation.
Step 18: Verify the user is successfully navigated to the dashboard.
acceptance_criteria: An admin can successfully send an invitation to a new user.
The sent invitation appears correctly in the 'Pending Invitations' list.
The invitation can be accepted, leading to the account creation form.
The new user can successfully provide their details, create a password, and submit the form.
Upon submission, the new user account is created, and the user is logged in and redirected to the main dashboard.

dependencies: The test environment must be stable and the application must be accessible at the specified Base URL.
A valid external Excel file containing all required test data columns must be available and correctly formatted.
For scenarios involving formula creation, the prerequisite metrics (e.g., 'First Metric', 'Second Metric') must already exist in the system before the test begins.
The user account used to initiate the tests must have the necessary permissions to invite users and create metrics.
A clean-up process is required to delete created users and metrics after test execution to ensure a consistent state for subsequent test runs.
